text: The Sweden national youth handball team is the national under–18 handball team of Sweden. Controlled by the Swedish Handball Federation it represents Sweden in international matches. ==History== ===World Championship record=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Year !Round !Position |- |Qatar 2005||Did not qualify|| |- style="background:#cfaa88;" |Bahrain 2007||Semifinals||3rd |- style="background:#cfaa88;" |Tunisia 2009||Semifinals||3rd |- style="background:#cfaa88;" |Argentina 2011||Semifinals||3rd |- |Hungary 2013||Quarterfinals||6th |- |Russia 2015||Quarterfinals||5th |- |Georgia 2017||Quarterfinals||5th |- |North Macedonia 2019||Round of 16||11th |- !Total||||0 Titles |} ===European Championship record=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Year !Round !Position |- |Switzerland 1992||Did not qualify|| |- |Israel 1994||Group stage||9th |- style="background:gold;" |Estonia 1997||Final Round||1st |- |Portugal 1999||Did not qualify|| |- style="background:#cfaa88;" |Luxembourg 2001||Semi-finals||3rd |- |Slovakia 2003||Did not qualify|| |- |Serbia and Montenegro 2004||Group stage||7th |- style="background:#cfaa88;" |Estonia 2006||Semi-finals||3rd |- style="background:#cfaa88;" |Czech Republic 2008||Semi-finals||3rd |- |Montenegro 2010||Group stage||7th |- style="background:silver;" |Austria 2012||Final Round||2nd |- |Poland 2014||Quarterfinals||5th |- |Croatia 2016||Group stage||9th |- style="background:gold;" |Croatia 2018||Final Round||1st |- !Total||||2 Titles |} ==References== ==External links== *Official website *Sweden (18 Team) at eurohandball.com Category:Handball in Sweden Category:Men's national youth handball teams Handball Category:Youth sport in Sweden
